Package com.jml.optimizers

Class Adam

java.lang.Object
com.jml.optimizers.Optimizer
com.jml.optimizers.Adam
public class Adam extends Optimizer
The Adam (Adaptive Moment Estimation) optimizer. Adam is a first order gradient method for efficient stochastic optimization.

This is recommended as the default optimizer on most problems. Applies the following update rule: 
      gt = grad(wt-1)
      mt = b1*mt-1 + (1-b1)*gt
      vt = b2*vt-1 + (1-b2)*gt2

      m̂t = mt/(1-b1t)
      v̂t = vt/(1-b2t)

      wt = wt-1 - a*m̂t/(√(v̂t) + ϵ)

      Where a is the learning rate, b1 and b2 are the moment parameters,
      and ϵ is a small value to avoid division bny zero.

  • Method Details

    • step

      public linalg.Matrix step​(linalg.Matrix w, linalg.Matrix wGrad)
      Steps the optimizer a single iteration by applying the update rule of the optimizer to the matrix w.

      WARNING: If this step method is called for the Momentum optimizer an exception will be thrown. Use step(Matrix, Matrix, Matrix) instead.

      Specified by:
      step in class Optimizer
      Parameters:
      w - A matrix containing the weights to apply the update to.
      wGrad - The gradient of w with respect to some function (Most likely a model).
      Returns:
      The result of applying the update rule of the optimizer to the matrix w.

    • step

      public linalg.Matrix[] step​(linalg.Matrix w, linalg.Matrix wGrad, linalg.Matrix v)
      Steps the optimizer a single iteration by applying the update rule of the optimizer to the matrix w. This step method should be used for momentum.
      Specified by:
      step in class Optimizer
      Parameters:
      w - A matrix containing the weights to apply the update to.
      wGrad - The gradient of w with respect to some function (Most likely a model).
      v - The update vector for the momentum optimizer. If the optimizer is GradientDescent This will have no effect.
      Returns:
      The result of applying the update rule of the optimizer to the matrix w.
